void.string: SELECT trg.triggername as trigger_name, case when trg.type ='A' then 'AFTER' else 'BEFORE' end as trigger_type , case when trg.event = 'D' then 'DELETE' else case when trg.event = 'I' then 'INSERT' else case when trg.event = 'U' THEN 'UPDATE' end end end as trigger_event from sys.systriggers trg, sys.systables t, sys.sysschemas s where trg.tableid = t.tableid and t.schemaid = s.schemaid
SELECT trigger_name, trigger_type, triggering_event as trigger_event FROM all_triggers
select trigname as trigger_name, trigtime as trigger_type, event from systriggers
select class_name||'.'||class_method as trigger_name, mode as trigger_type, command as event from definition_schema.systriggers
SELECT trigger_name, trigger_type, triggering_event as trigger_event FROM all_triggers

select tr.name as trigger_name, case 1 when ObjectProperty( tr.id, 'ExecIsAfterTrigger') then 'AFTER' else 'BEFORE' end as trigger_type, case 1 when ObjectProperty( tr.id, 'ExecIsUpdateTrigger') then 'UPDATE' when ObjectProperty( tr.id, 'ExecIsDeleteTrigger') then 'DELETE' when ObjectProperty( tr.id, 'ExecIsInsertTrigger') then 'INSERT' end as trigger_event from sysobjects tr, sysobjects tab where tab.id = tr.parent_obj and tr.xtype = 'TR'

select trg.tgname, case trg.tgtype & cast(2 as int2) when 0 then 'AFTER' else 'BEFORE' end as trigger_type, case trg.tgtype & cast(28 as int2) when 16 then 'UPDATE' when 8 then 'DELETE' when 4 then 'INSERT' when 20 then 'INSERT, UPDATE' when 28 then 'INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE' when 24 then 'UPDATE, DELETE' when 12 then 'INSERT, DELETE' end as trigger_event from pg_trigger trg, pg_class tbl where trg.tgrelid = tbl.oid
SELECT trigger_name, action_timing AS trigger_type, event_manipulation as trigger_event FROM information_schema.triggers
SELECT trigger_name, trigger_type, triggering_event as trigger_event from information_schema.system_triggers

SELECT rdb$trigger_name AS TRIGGER_NAME, case rdb$trigger_type when 0 then 'UNKNOWN' when 1 then 'BEFORE' when 2 then 'AFTER' when 3 then 'BEFORE' when 4 then 'AFTER' when 5 then 'BEFORE' when 6 then 'AFTER' END AS trigger_type, case rdb$trigger_type when 0 then 'UNKNOWN' when 1 then 'INSERT' when 2 then 'INSERT' when 3 then 'UPDATE' when 4 then 'UPDATE' when 5 then 'DELETE' when 6 then 'DELETE' END AS trigger_event FROM rdb$triggers

select rdef.rule_name as trigger_name, 'AFTER' as trigger_type, case rdef.rule_statement when 1 then 'DELETE' when 2 then 'INSERT' when 4 then 'UPDATE' when 3 then 'INSERT,DELETE' when 6 then 'INSERT,UPDATE' when 5 then 'UPDATE,DELETE' when 7 then 'INSERT,UPDATE,DELETE' else '' end as trigger_event from iirule rdef, iirules rlist where rdef.rule_name = rlist.rule_name
